item.title: China’s Propaganda Playbook for Targeting Rivals
item.description: China’s state propaganda machine has a toolbox for undermining leaders that includes fake opinion polls, “lawfare” and general character assassination.
item.dc:creator: Peter Saidel

item.title: The Two Faces of Venezuela’s Regime Smile at the U.S. and Glower at Home
item.description: After the ouster of Nicolás Maduro, the entrenched Venezuelan leadership has softened its tone toward Washington—while anti-American rhetoric endures.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Dubé

item.title: Trump’s Military Buildup in Caribbean Limits His Options in Iran
item.description: While no U.S. aircraft-carrier strike group is in the Middle East, officials insist there are sufficient military assets in the region to strike Iran.
item.dc:creator: Shelby Holliday

item.title: Welcome to Greenland, an Economy Reliant on Subsidies and Shrimp
item.description: Greenlanders get heavily subsidized by Denmark, and any future mining boom will be costly.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: Trump Says Iran Has Stopped Killing Protesters
item.description: The Oval Office comments came after the U.S. evacuated some personnel from a Qatar air base in a move described as a precaution.
item.dc:creator: Ken Thomas

item.title: Opinion | Where’s Congress on Russia Sanctions?
item.description: Trump has given the green light for a tariff bill on countries that buy Russian oil.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | India’s Timid Economic Reforms
item.description: Modi tinkers with the rules to make them slightly less oppressive, but the country needs a free-market overhaul.
item.dc:creator: Sadanand Dhume

item.title: Opinion | My Country, Somaliland, Recognized
item.description: Our first embassy will be in the Jewish state, whose aspirations and history we share.
item.dc:creator: Abdirahman Mohamed Abdullahi

item.title: Iran Signals Plans for Swift Trials and Executions of Protesters
item.description: The regime’s top judicial official has called for quick action against protesters convicted of vandalism and other offenses.
item.dc:creator: David S. Cloud

item.title: State Department to Pause Visa Processing for 75 Countries
item.description: The move comes as part of the Trump administration’s crackdown on low-income foreigners moving to the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Vera Bergengruen

item.title: Opinion | America Is the Sole Superpower Again
item.description: China could have been a contender, but Trump has led the U.S. to a new ‘unipolar moment.’
item.dc:creator: Arthur Herman

item.title: Opinion | No Leftist Solidarity for Iran
item.description: Why don’t Democrats stand with the protesters opposing the regime?

item.title: U.S. to Unveil Gaza Governance Plan Despite Concerns Over Hamas
item.description: Hamas hasn’t yet begun disarming, a fact some officials believe could imperil the peace plan.
item.dc:creator: Summer Said

item.title: European Defense Companies in Line to Benefit From Bulk of EU’s $105 Billion Ukraine Loan
item.description: Ukraine must buy weapons and military platforms from European manufacturers, unless they aren’t able to supply what Kyiv needs.
item.dc:creator: Cristina Gallardo

item.title: Japan’s New Prime Minister Set to Call Snap Election
item.description: Sanae Takaichi hopes to cement her grip on power as she battles Chinese anger over remarks she made about Taiwan.
item.dc:creator: Jason Douglas

item.title: China Imports to Help Lower U.K. Inflation to Target, BOE’s Taylor Says
item.description: The annual rate of inflation is likely to fall to the Bank of England’s 2% target by the middle of this year, aided by cheap imports from China, the rate-setter said.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: China’s Record Trade Surplus Defies Expectations for Tariff-Driven Slowdown
item.description: The 2025 record showed that the world’s second-largest economy remained resilient despite facing steep Trump administration tariffs that slashed its exports to the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Miao

item.title: Venezuela Frees Detained Americans in Slow Release of Political Prisoners
item.description: U.S. officials described the move as an important step in the wake of the authoritarian leader Nicolás Maduro’s ouster.
item.dc:creator: Michael Amon

item.title: Venezuelan Opposition’s Calls to Oust Maduro Aided Legal Case for Removal, Memo Says
item.description: The assertion that helped justify the U.S. military operation against the Venezuelan leader was redacted in a publicly released version of the Justice Department memo.
item.dc:creator: Vera Bergengruen

item.title: The Obscure Bank Collapse That Sent Iran Into a Tailspin
item.description: Bad loans to regime cronies brought down Ayandeh Bank, accelerating a long-running financial crisis.
item.dc:creator: Jared Malsin

item.title: U.S. Blows Up China’s Latin America Ambitions With Maduro Ouster
item.description: Beijing is recalculating its policy of making inroads in Washington’s backyard after its top ally there was deposed.
item.dc:creator: Lingling Wei

item.title: The U.S.’s Two Foremost Asian Allies Are on Good Terms—an Irritant for China
item.description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung and Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi displayed unity in a high-profile summit.
item.dc:creator: Jason Douglas

item.title: Opinion | What Does the U.S. Operation in Venezuela Mean?
item.description: University students react to the capture of Nicolás Maduro and discuss what it means for them and for the world.

item.title: Trump Tells Iranian Protesters ‘Help Is On Its Way’
item.description: The president rules out talks with Iran’s regime after the deaths of hundreds of demonstrators, and says Americans should leave the country.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: An Isolated Iran Finds China’s Friendship Has Limits
item.description: Beijing denounced Trump’s 25% tariff on countries that do business with Tehran, but seems reluctant to offer more support.
item.dc:creator: Austin Ramzy

item.title: Iran’s Gulf Rivals Warn U.S. Against Strike on Tehran
item.description: Saudi Arabia is leading the charge to persuade Washington not to intervene.
item.dc:creator: Omar Abdel-Baqui

item.title: Greenland’s Prime Minister Says Island Would Choose Denmark Over U.S.
item.description: The Arctic island’s leader seeks to portray unity with Copenhagen ahead of White House meetings on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Sune Engel Rasmussen

item.title: Iran Is Hunting Down Starlink Users to Stop Protest Videos From Going Global
item.description: Video from the streets is one of the few ways of getting information out about the scale of the protests and the actions of Iranian authorities.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: South Korean Prosecutors Seek Death Penalty for Former Leader
item.description: Judges will review the recommendation for Yoon Suk Yeol, who briefly instituted martial law over a year ago and faced charges of insurrection.
item.dc:creator: Dasl Yoon

item.title: The Battle Over Who Runs the Panama Canal Ports Is About to Be Decided
item.description: The Panamanian Supreme Court is winding up deliberations in a lawsuit that could void a Chinese company’s license to operate the ports and hand President Trump a win.
item.dc:creator: Santiago Pérez

item.title: U.K. House Prices Expected to Rise But London Likely to Straggle
item.description: U.K. house prices are expected to rise in 2026, with Scotland and Northern England showing the strongest growth and sales prospects, according to real-estate website Zoopla.
item.dc:creator: Anthony O. Goriainoff

item.title: Military Experts Reject Trump’s Logic That U.S. Must Own Greenland to Defend It
item.description: The U.S. president’s assertion runs counter to decades of policy and undermines deterrence, say former military and diplomatic officials.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Michaels

item.title: A Custody Battle Over Dogs Rocks an African Nation
item.description: Palace guard dogs are said to protect Malawi’s president from intruders and witchcraft. The outgoing leader decided to keep a few.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: White House Weighs Iran’s Nuclear-Talks Offer as Trump Leans Toward Strikes
item.description: Some senior administration aides, led by Vice President JD Vance, are urging Trump to try diplomacy before retaliating against Iran for killing protesters.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Andrews

item.title: Mexico Rejects Trump’s Plea for U.S. Forces to Take On Cartels
item.description: The administration is stepping up pressure on Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum after the ouster of Venezuela’s Maduro.

item.title: Venezuela Opposition Leader to Visit White House on Thursday
item.description: Nobel Peace Prize winner María Corina Machado will seek to reassert her role in Venezuela’s transition.

item.title: Iran Moderates Back Crackdown on Protests as Regime Closes Ranks
item.description: The protests, in which more than 500 people have died, have grown into a more serious threat to the Islamic Republic.

item.title: Canada Anticipates Progress in China Talks to Resolve Trade Row
item.description: Canada anticipates progress with China on resolving trade irritants regarding canola and electric vehicles during Prime Minister Mark Carney visit’s to Beijing this week, officials said.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: ECB’s Villeroy Backs Powell, Sees 2026 Rate Rise as ‘Fanciful’
item.description: The ECB is very unlikely to raise its key interest rate this year, with a weaker dollar among a number of potential developments keeping eurozone inflation low, Bank of France Governor Francois Villeroy de Galhau said.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: Australia’s Critical Minerals Reserve to First Focus on Antimony, Gallium, Rare Earths
item.description: Canberra is working with Washington and other allies to diversify global critical-mineral supply chains that are dominated by China.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: South Africa Risks Angering Trump by Hosting Navies of Iran, Russia, China
item.description: The military exercises come at a time of already strained relations with the U.S.

item.title: Inside Ukraine’s Quest to Build a Missile to Strike Deep in Russian Territory
item.description: The company that built one of the country’s most potent drones is trying to replicate its success with a cruise missile.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: Greenland Was America’s Friend. Now It’s a Takeover Target.
item.description: Few locals in Nuuk believe U.S. troops are arriving imminently, but there is growing unease that President Trump’s desire to buy Greenland or use military force might actually be serious.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Michaels

item.title: U.S. Forces Seize Fifth Tanker in Campaign to Track Down Venezuelan Oil
item.description: The U.S. Coast Guard intercepted the sanctioned tanker Olina in waters near Venezuela.

item.title: China Warns AI Startups Seeking to Emulate Meta Deal: Not So Fast
item.description: Beijing worries the $2.5 billion acquisition of startup Manus will encourage more entrepreneurs to follow in its footsteps.

item.title: China Detains Church Leaders as Crackdown on Religion Intensifies
item.description: Authorities have taken away at least four members of a high-profile “house church” in Sichuan province as a campaign to root out religious organizations beyond the state’s control intensifies.
item.dc:creator: Brian Spegele

item.title: Cambodian Scam Tycoon Wanted by U.S. Extradited to China
item.description: The Justice Department accused Chen Zhi of running a sprawling scam empire targeting Americans.

item.title: U.S. Escalates Venezuela Oil Embargo With Two Tanker Seizures
item.description: American special forces boarded a vessel that had been pursued for two weeks, while the Coast Guard seized another tanker in waters off Latin America.

item.title: Russia Sends Submarine to Escort Tanker the U.S. Tried to Seize Off Venezuela

item.title: Israel Flexes New Diplomatic Muscle in Recognition of Somaliland
item.description: Two years of war have honed Israeli independence on the world stage.

item.title: Ukraine Seeks Decadeslong Security Guarantee as Trump Offers 15 Years
item.description: Kyiv said the guarantee offered by the U.S. would be too short to deter Russia from future aggression.

item.title: Trump Says Talks to End Ukraine War Yield Progress Though Hurdles Remain
item.description: The U.S. president offers few specifics after a phone call with Russian President Vladimir Putin and a meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.

item.title: Thailand, Cambodia Agree to Immediate Cease-Fire in Border Clashes
item.description: At least 22 civilians—21 in Cambodia and one in Thailand—have been killed since an earlier truce collapsed on Dec. 8.

item.title: U.S. Strikes on Nigeria Targeted Islamic State Camps With Missile Barrage
item.description: The U.S. military said multiple militants had been killed in an attack that again showed President Trump’s focus on deterring violence against Christians.

item.title: India Is on a Himalayan Building Spree to Prepare for a Clash With China
item.description: A deadly standoff jolted India to stitch together a huge network of roads, tunnels and landing strips needed to move soldiers and supplies to the mountainous border region.

item.title: Bondi Beach Terror Suspects Condemned ‘Zionists’ and Amassed an Arsenal
item.description: Court documents reveal what police say were the movements and motivation of Sajid and Naveed Akram.

item.title: U.K. Government Borrowing Fell, But Challenges Ahead
item.description: The narrower November deficit was largely due to an increase in revenues following the government’s decision to increase a tax on employment.

item.title: U.K. Inflation Slows to Eight-Month Low as BOE Prepares Rate Decision
item.description: Prices cooled more than expected in November, keeping the Bank of England on course for a fourth interest-rate cut of the year.

item.title: Bondi Beach Attack Badly Shakes Sense of Safety for Australia’s Jews
item.description: There has been frustration among Sydney’s Jewish community that authorities haven’t heeded warnings about a rise in antisemitism.

item.title: Father and Son Used Licensed Firearms in Sydney Terror Attack, Police Say

item.title: Terrorist Attack Targets Jews at Sydney’s Bondi Beach, Killing 15
item.description: The suspects are a father, also killed, and his son, in the shooting at a Hanukkah event.

item.title: Charles III Gives ‘Good News’ on Cancer Treatment
item.description: The British monarch, who was diagnosed last year, said his treatment is due to be scaled back in 2026.

item.title: ‘India’ and ‘Let My Country Awake’ Review: History at an Audacious Scale
item.description: Audrey Truschke’s single-volume work makes a bold attempt to capture thousands of years of cultural ferment on the Indian subcontinent.

item.description: The two countries’ reliance on each other in the energy sector is coming under strain.

item.title: Putin and Modi Deepen Relationship That Has Drawn Trump’s Anger
item.description: The Russian president is embarking on a high-profile visit to India, aiming to protect a partnership that is a crucial for Moscow.

item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.

item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
